content.question: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations.Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations.As part of a study on the chemistry of Alaskan streams, researchers took water samples from many streams with temperatures colder than <math alttext="8 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn><mtext>°C</mtext></math> and from many streams with temperatures warmer than <math alttext="8 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn><mtext>°C</mtext></math>. For each sample, the researchers measured the dissolved oxygen concentration, in milligrams per liter (<math alttext="m g slash l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>mg/l</mtext></math>).(a) The researchers constructed the histogram shown for the dissolved oxygen concentration in streams from the sample with water temperatures colder than <math alttext="8 degrees Celsius " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn><mtext>°C</mtext></math>. Based on the histogram, describe the distribution of dissolved oxygen concentration in streams with water temperatures colder than <math alttext="8 degrees Celsius " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn><mtext>°C</mtext></math>.

frqParts.text: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations.Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations.As part of a study on the chemistry of Alaskan streams, researchers took water samples from many streams with temperatures colder than <math alttext="8 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn><mtext>°C</mtext></math> and from many streams with temperatures warmer than <math alttext="8 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn><mtext>°C</mtext></math>. For each sample, the researchers measured the dissolved oxygen concentration, in milligrams per liter (<math alttext="m g slash l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>mg/l</mtext></math>).(a) The researchers constructed the histogram shown for the dissolved oxygen concentration in streams from the sample with water temperatures colder than <math alttext="8 degrees Celsius " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn><mtext>°C</mtext></math>. Based on the histogram, describe the distribution of dissolved oxygen concentration in streams with water temperatures colder than <math alttext="8 degrees Celsius " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn><mtext>°C</mtext></math>.

<math alttext="Minimum" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Min</mtext></math><math alttext="Q 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Q1</mtext></math><math alttext="Median" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Median</mtext></math><math alttext="Q 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Q3</mtext></math><math alttext="Maximum" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Max</mtext></math><math alttext="Mean" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Mean</mtext></math><math alttext="Standard Deviation" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Std. Dev.</mtext></math><math alttext="2.10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.10</mn></math><math alttext="4.39" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.39</mn></math><math alttext="5.43" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.43</mn></math><math alttext="6.12" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6.12</mn></math><math alttext="13.45" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>13.45</mn></math><math alttext="5.54" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.54</mn></math><math alttext="1.64" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.64</mn></math>(b) The researchers computed the summary statistics shown in the table for the dissolved oxygen concentration in streams from the sample with water temperatures warmer than <math alttext="8 degrees Celsius " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn><mtext>°C</mtext></math>. Use the summary statistics to construct a box plot for the dissolved oxygen concentration in streams with water temperatures warmer than <math alttext="8 degrees Celsius " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn><mtext>°C</mtext></math>. Do not indicate outliers.

(c) The researchers believe that streams with higher dissolved oxygen concentration are generally healthier for wildlife. Which streams are generally healthier for wildlife, those with water temperature colder than <math alttext="8 degrees Celsius " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn><mo>°</mo><mo> </mo><mtext>C</mtext></math> or those with water temperature warmer than <math alttext="8 degrees Celsius " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn><mo>°</mo><mo> </mo><mtext>C</mtext></math> ? Using characteristics of the distribution of dissolved oxygen concentration for temperatures colder than <math alttext="8 degrees Celsius " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn><mtext>°C</mtext></math> and characteristics of the distribution of dissolved oxygen concentration for temperatures warmer than <math alttext="8 degrees Celsius " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn><mtext>°C</mtext></math>, justify your answer.

topic.text: 1.6: Describing the Distribution of a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Describe data presented numerically or graphically.
